theme: Grow in knowledge of Jesus while waiting for His return - resist false teachers
structure: Ch 1: Grow in godliness and knowledge
Ch 3: Day of the Lord is coming
messiahProfile: Lord and Savior whose return is certain though delayed
overview: Peter's final letter warns against false teachers and encourages growth in knowledge of Jesus while waiting for His return.

expository.context: Peter writing to churches facing false teachers
expository.tension: How do we grow in godliness? What does Jesus give us?
expository.structure: v.3-4 (Divine power and promises), v.5-7 (Add to your faith), v.8-11 (Fruitful and assured)
expository.messiahProfile: The one whose glory and goodness called us
expository.messiahLink: Jesus gives us everything needed for life and godliness through knowing Him
expository.notes: Classic virtue list - but it starts with God's power, not our effort

expository.tension: Why the delay? Has God forgotten His promise?
expository.structure: v.1-7 (Scoffers will come), v.8-10 (God's timing), v.11-13 (How then shall we live?)
expository.messiahProfile: Lord whose return is certain like a thief
expository.messiahLink: Jesus will return suddenly to judge and make all things new
expository.notes: Delay = patience, not forgetfulness. One day with the Lord = 1000 years

prophetic.strengthen: God is patient with you - He wants all to come to repentance
prophetic.encourage: New heavens and new earth are coming - live holy lives now
prophetic.console: The delay isn't abandonment - it's mercy giving time for salvation
prophetic.notes: 1 Cor 14:3 framework - strengthen, encourage, console based on 2 Peter 3:9-13
